decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with: drawing numbers: 1901-010 (includes Site Location Plan), 1901-010, 1901-020, 1901-041, 1901-040, received: 22.05.2020 drawing number: 1901-200, received via email: 01.10.2020 drawing number: 1901-100, received via email: 09.09.2020 drawing number: 1901-002 (Rev. 0; showing proposed front boundary treatment), received via email: 29.10.2020

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Refuse and recycling storage shall be implemented in accordance with the Local Planning Authority policies before the first occupation of the residential care home hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 5.3 and 5.16 of the London Plan (2016). | The site shall be used as a children's residential care home only (Use Class C2) and shall not be used for any other purposes, including any other C2 use or any other uses in the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain control over the nature of the use, in the interests of restricting the uses of the building to those which are compatible with the site and area, and to protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality, all in accordance with policies 1.1 and 4.1 of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 3B and 7A of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The number of children accommodated at the site shall not exceed a maximum of four at any time.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality, and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 4.1 of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 6.13 and 7A of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The number of staff at the site shall not exceed a maximum of six staff between the hours of 07:00 and 22:00 (day shift) and a maximum of three staff members between the hours of 22:00 and 07:00 (night shift).

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality, and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 4.1 of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 6.13 and 7A of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021)
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2016 (as amended) (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policy 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policy D4 of the London Plan (2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, pedestrian visibility splays should be provided at all times measuring 1.5m by 1.5m, with no obstruction more than 0.6m high for the vehicle access where it meets the back edge of the footway; these shall be established prior to the first use of the driveway for car parking and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interest of highways safety in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) | Secure and sheltered cycle storage for a minimum of two cycle parking spaces (one for staff and one for residents) shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the development provides a suitable level of cycle parking provision in the interests of sustainable transport, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan (2021). | The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating communal main entrance/ kitchen/livingroom/snug from bedrooms shall be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS 8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with standard 30 of the Housing SPG and D4 of the London Plan (2021). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented during construction of the development hereby approved: - noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014), - dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition), - lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals), - hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800- 1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays, Committee/Delegated Report Application Number: 201987FUL Location: 30 Farndale Crescent, Greenford, Middlesex, UB6 9LL - notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison, and - public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policy D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | The boundary treatment and dropped kerb shown on drawing number: 1901-002 (Rev. 0; showing proposed front boundary treatment) shall be installed prior to first occupation of the care home hereby approved and retained in perpetuity.

Reason: To ensure vehicle access to the site does not compromise the safety of pedestrians or involve driving over the kerb in accordance with the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S.73) for the variation of conditions 5 (number of residents) and 6 (numbers of staff) pursuant to planning permission Ref: 201987FUL dated 02.11.2020 for 'Change of use from single dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to residential care home (Use Class C2); facilitated by hip to gable roof alteration; rear roof extension; single storey side/rear extension; installation of vehicle crossover; and front boundary treatment'. Variation seeks to increase staff numbers and decrease resident numbers
